attributes.action: Ensure all universities have a safe, socially-distanced graduation this summer
attributes.additional_details: As of April 20th, all of the vulnerable population in the UK have been offered a first dose of a COVID vaccine, (everyone over 50 and under 50 with underlying health conditions) with the most prioritised now receiving their second dose. By the original planned graduation week in mid-July, the vast majority of the UK adult population would have been offered a vaccine. As a final year undergraduate student myself I felt extremely blindsided that my university and others are postponning graduation.
attributes.background: The Government promised the British public that by the 21st of June, most restricitons will be relaxed meaning outdoor events can take place in a safe manner. I am asking the universities minister in particular to ensure that promise is given to us by ensuring graduation takes place this summer.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about whether to hold graduation ceremonies are a matter for individual universities, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
